intro: Canthium suborbiculare, commonly known as the round-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often unusual floral structures. The plant features palmately lobed leaves that are typically rounded or heart-shaped, giving it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are usually greenish-yellow and lack showy petals. Canthium suborbiculare is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
